meanings.definition: To go beyond or exceed (a limit or boundary)
meanings.sent1: The car overshoots the speed limit on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The rocket overshot its target and landed in the next field.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel overshot the tree branch and landed in a pile of leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her excitement overshot the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The balloon overshot the tree, floating higher and higher into the sky.

meanings.definition: To pass or fly over (a target or destination)
meanings.sent1: The bird overshoots the nest and has to circle back around.
meanings.sent2: The plane overshot the runway and had to make a second attempt.
meanings.sent3: The soccer ball overshot the goal and hit the referee instead.
meanings.sent4: His dreams overshot the small town and reached for the big city lights.
meanings.sent5: The arrow overshot the bullseye, landing in the outer ring of the target.

meanings.definition: To shoot or go too far in a particular direction
meanings.sent1: The basketball player overshoots the hoop and misses the shot.
meanings.sent2: The hiker overshot the trail and got lost in the woods.
meanings.sent3: The chef overshot the salt in the soup, making it too salty to eat.
meanings.sent4: His enthusiasm overshot the mark, making others uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The car overshot the turn, ending up in the ditch on the side of the road.
